Name: Julius
description:
Julius, a resilient 64-year-old entrepreneur from Nyeri, Kenya, epitomizes perseverance in the face of adversity.

Married with three children in school, Julius shoulders the responsibility of providing for his family, supporting them through his ventures.

His primary occupation involves quarrying, supplemented by subsistence farming, where he finds solace in the fruitful returns it yields.

Despite his dedication, Julius encounters challenges, notably the menace of floods that disrupt his quarrying activities.

In dire need of financial assistance, he seeks a KRS 60,000 loan to secure excavation space, ensuring uninterrupted operations and also boosting his farm with quality farm inputs.

While Julius operates his business independently, his contributions extend beyond personal gains, enriching the wider community through his entrepreneurial endeavors.

With a track record of timely repayment, Julius envisions a future where Kiva loans catalyze the growth of his farming enterprise, empowering him to provide better opportunities for his children and secure their future.
